ii.gloss: the cardinal number that is the sum of one and one or a numeral representing this number

ii chronicles.gloss: the second of two Old Testament books telling the history of Judah and Israel until the return from the Babylonian Captivity in 536 BC

ii corinthians.gloss: a New Testament book containing the second epistle from Saint Paul to the church at Corinth

synonyms.word: second epistle of paul the apostle to the corinthians

ii esdras.gloss: an Apocryphal book of angelic revelations

ii john.gloss: the second New Testament epistle traditionally attributed to Saint John the Apostle

ii kings.gloss: the second of two Old Testament books telling the histories of the kings of Judah and Israel

ii maccabees.gloss: an Apocryphal book describing the life of Judas Maccabaeus

ii peter.gloss: the second New Testament book traditionally attributed to Saint Peter the Apostle

ii samuel.gloss: the second of two books of the Old Testament that tell of Saul and David

ii thessalonians.gloss: a New Testament book containing Saint Paul's second epistle to the Thessalonians

synonyms.word: second epistle of paul the apostle to the thessalonians

ii timothy.gloss: a New Testament book containing Saint Paul's second epistle to Timothy

synonyms.word: second epistle of paul the apostle to timothy

iii.gloss: the cardinal number that is the sum of one and one and one

iii john.gloss: the third New Testament epistle traditionally attributed to Saint John the Apostle

iis.gloss: the most notorious and possibly the most important arm of Iraq's security system
